did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Personal papers through 1996, including all his poetry manuscripts arranged in sequence of composition by Eigner himself. Also literary and family correspondence, prose manuscripts, notebooks and juvenilia of Larry Eigner.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Larry Eigner papers, M0902. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Richard M. and Beverly Eigner, 1996 and 1997. Accession numbers 1996-256, 1997-006, 1997-190.

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: American poet born in Swampscott, MA, Eigner was confined his entire life to a wheelchair as a result of cerebral palsy. Educated at home by his parents, he lived with them in Swampscott until 1978, when he moved to California. Eigner's writing reflects his special perspective on the world, developing a distinctive style to register his uniquely distanced vision of the world. His first volume of poetry From the Sustaining Air was published in 1953 by Robert Creeley. His steady productivity resulted in numerous subsequent collections, including, Another Time in Fragments (1967), Things Stirring/ Together/ or Far Away (1974), now there's-a-morning-hulk of the sky (1981), and Waters/Places/ A Time (1983). His short stories are collected in Farther North (1969) and his prose writings in Country/ Harbour/ Quiet/ Act/ Around: Selected Prose (1978) and Area/ Lights/ Heights: Selected Writings, 1954 -1989. His latest book of poetry is Windows/ Walls/ Yard/ Ways (1994), but at the time of his death he had just completed work on a new collection Readiness/ Enough/ Depends/ On, now forthcoming.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers include the typescripts of all of Eigner's poetry, arranged in sequence by the author, many with holographic notations by Eigner. Also included is correspondence to Eigner arranged alphabetically by the correspondent's name. Major correspondents include from Cid Corman, Clayton Eshleman, Arthur McFarland, James Weil, Douglas Woolf, and many others. There are also copies of some of Eigner's return correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Boxes #1 through #7 contain materials documenting Larry Eigner?s poetical works. These papers are arranged in the sequences Eigner himself devised and used. The papers consist predominantly of photocopy and carbon copies of typescripts, the originals of which are in the University of Kansas Library. Many of these copies do, however, have holographic notations, most of which are extremely difficult to read. There are some original manuscript works included, also with notations. Boxes #8 through #12 contain letters to Eigner arranged alphabetically by the correspondent?s name. Larger and more important files are from Cid Corman, Clayton Eshleman, Arthur McFarland, James Weil, and Douglas Woolf. Occasional copies of Eigner?s own letters are present and noted. The major exception to this pattern is the McFarland file which includes Eigner?s original correspondence to McFarland. Boxes 13-20 comprise the rest of the material from the original 1996 accession. Additional material from later accessions are found in Boxes 21-31.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: American literature--20th century.
Poets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Series:
scopecontent.p: Material owned by Eigner, but not written by him. Contains correspondence from other writers, reviews of his work, work in progress for compilations, and copies of poetry by others writers.

#16: Transcripts and texts by Robert Grenier
#17: Various pamphlets, programs, bulletins - some w/holographic notations by Eigner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Series:
scopecontent.p: Definitive versions of Eigner works compiled by Robert Grenier under the direction of Larry Eigner. Most of this material is already at Kansas University Library.

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Larry Eigner to Joe and Janet Eigner, November 1981 to December 1989

scopecontent.p: Many include envelope w/ typed notations by Larry Eigner and reply from Joseph. Also includes 20 postcards from Larry Eigner to Joseph Eigner, sheets of typed poetry (photocopies), and newsclippings. 1. Object Permanence #4 (Photocopy) w/ letter to Joe and Janet Eigner (written by a third party) on reverse, July, 2 1995, signed "Larry" (Eigner); 2. ALS, 5 letters to Joe and Janet Eigner (written by a third party), July 1995 - December 1995, signed "Larry" (Eigner) w/ copies of Joseph's replies.

did.unittitle: Joseph and Janet Eigner: Correspondence from Larry Eigner to Joseph and Janet Eigner, circa 1963 - 1976.

scopecontent.p: Many running to multiple pages and including copies of his poetry. Some of the letters are typed on paper scraps, backs of envelopes, and the reverse of letters sent to him. Also includes 6 postcards, 10 newsclippings, and copies of letters to Joe Eigner from other correspondents. 1. TLS, 52 letters, (122p.) to Joseph and Janet Eigner, signed in type "Larry" (Eigner); 2. TLS(Carbon), 2 letters, (7p.) to Joseph and Janet Eigner, 1976, signed in type "Larry" (Eigner); 3. TLS, 2p. to Richie (Eigner), May 15, 1976, signed in type "Larry" (Eigner); 4. ALS, 1p. on reverse of birthday card. To "Joe" (Eigner), signed "Larry" (Eigner); 5. TLS, 5 letters. (9p.), 1971 - 1976, to "Children," signed "Mom" (Eigner); 6. TLS, 2p, signed "George Bowring"; 7. Typed (Poetry) Manuscript(Carbon), 7p., "A Miscellany for Vera Williams and Larry Eigner," signed in type "Jackson Mac Low"; 8. Typed (Poetry) Manuscript pages, 17p.; 9. Typed (Poetry) Manuscript pages (Photocopy), 4p.; 10. Typed (Poetry) Manuscript pages (Carbon), 25p.

did.unittitle: Folder 35 - Other Correspondence to Larry Eigner

scopecontent.p: From poets and publishers of his work, circa 1959 - 71. Major correspondents (one letter from each unless noted) include Hugh Fox; Blaz(Open Skull Press); The Sumac Press; 3 letters from Cid Corman (w/ photocopy of Eigner reply); Christopher Waylen; Michael McClure; Montgomery Tyson; 3 letters from Richard Peabody(Gargoyle); 3 letters from Jim Koller; The restau press; John Taggart; 1 postcard from Gilbert Sorrentino; Jackson Mac Low; Fred R. Fry; Bruce Andrews; 3 letters from Anne Mazonson; 3 letters from Kris Hemensley; 3 letters from Stuart Montgomery (The Fulcrum Press); 5 letters from Ian (Tetrad Press); 5 letters from John Martin (Black Sparrow Press); 3 letters from Anne Mazonson; 3 postcards from Terence Inman; and others. Approximately 110 letters and 16 postcards. Also contains envelope w/ saved addresses of correspondents. Paper is heavily handled.
Flyers, circulars, programs, photocopies, newsclippings, typed (poetry) pages from correspondents.
Includes articles about Larry Eigner, publications of his work and reviews of his poetry. Approximately 40 pieces.
Manuscript(Carbon), 39p., High Life from the Hospital Bedrooms; TLS(photocopy), 2p., September 5, 1962, To "M. Ferlengh," signed in Type " Larry Eigner".
